text: A near-close vowel (or near-high vowel) is a vowel sound used in some spoken languages. The meaning of a near-close vowel is that the tongue is positioned the same as an close vowel, but slightly less narrow. ==List== The near-close vowels with these symbols in the International Phonetic Alphabet are: * near- close near-front unrounded vowel * near-close near-front rounded vowel * near- close near-back rounded vowel Other near-close vowels can have marks on letters of relative articulation applied to neighboring vowels, such as and for near-close, near-back, rounded and unrounded vowels. == References == Category:Vowels
title: Near-close vowel
